Robert Wenner <robert@...> wrote:
On Thursday 11 March 2004 12:58, Rafael Lopes wrote:
> protected void runTest() throws Throwable {
>
> new MatematicaTest("testSoma");
>
> new MatematicaTest("testSubtrai");
>
> new MatematicaTest("testMultiplica");
>
> new MatematicaTest("testDividir");
>
> }

This only creates the tests, but does not run them.
You don't have to do that manually, JUnit will collect the test for you.
You don't need that method, just run your test case with whatever runner 
you want.

Robert
